page.title: 15Visit to Village Theatre EK
page.content: In June 1985 my primary class went on a visit to East Kilbride Theatre. This modern and well equipped small theatre was opened in 1977 by the famous Scot- tish actor Mr. Andrew Cruickshank. The theatre is used by the E Kilbride Light Opera who perform a musical show once a year, the E Kilbride Repertory Theatre Club who put on five plays and one pantomime every year and the EK Gilbert and Sullivan Society who stage an opera annually. The theatre is used for a Festival in August, while other uses include Young Farmers' Club Shows and displays by dancing and gymnastics clubs. Most of the clubs are amateur though famous professional actors do sometimes perform here also. We were shown backstage, were taught the technical terms for the equipment and were allowed to work the lights, the sound and the mirror ball.{(L.Petrie)
